Incident.Summary: On March 9th, 2023 at 1405 hours, Cynthia Rose reported her identity was stolen.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Video Recording Information: I am equipped with a body worn camera. The following incident was audibly and visually recorded. Scene Processing: No scene processing was required. Witness Statements / Neighborhood Check: There were no witnesses to this incident. Due to the nature of the incident, a neighborhood check was not completed. Mode of Operation: Unknonwn. Suspect: Unknown Victims: Rose, Cynthia 2/F, DOB 09/08/1967 3529 Bay Dr Baltimore, MD 21220 (443)-813-5276 CindyRose3529@comcast.net Narrative: On March 9th, 2023 at approximately 1400 hours, I, Trooper Lowery #7448 responded to the Maryland State Police Golden Ring Barrack for a report of an identity theft. Upon arrival, I met with Cynthia Rose (2/F 09/08/1967). Rose was interviewed in a conference room. Rose advised on February 21st, 2023 at 1446 hours she received an email from Comenity Fraud stating Comenity Fraud: Please verify chare on 21Feb $644.43 ULTA NUMBER 44 on your Ultamate Rewards acct ending 2623. Was this you? Please reply YES or NO. STOP2end. Rose replied with NO. Rose stated that is when Comentiy Fraud texted back Comenity Fraud: Thank you. We will close your card and send a new one, no further action required. Call ph# on back of your card if any charges are unrecognized. Rose stated directly after receiving the text messages she called the customer care number on the back of her bank card. Rose advised an agent from Comenity stated someone order two virtual master cards under her name, totaling the amount of $644.43. Rose advised she closed the account immediately. Rose advised that sometime in early March she saw a charge of $394, which the bank let through, not knowing it was a fraudulent charge. On March 6th, 2023 Rose stated she received an email from Victorias Secret stating Thank you for opening an account. Rose contacted the fraud department for Victorias Secret, in regard to a credit card being opened in her name. Victorias Secret advised that a credit card was not opened. After speaking with Victorias Secret fraud department, Rose stated she spoke with Equifax and Trans-union. Both companies forwarded all fraud complaints to Experian. Experian advised that if anyone was to open up any other accounts, they would contact Rose. On March 8th, 2023 at approximately 1530 hours, Rose stated she had a ton of emails from Experian credit, stating her credit file has been updated. Rose advised that Ulta, Victorias Secret, and Kohls all had an inquiry on Roses credit. On March 8th, 2023 Experian stated to Rose that there was an update on her address. The new address was 10786 W Sample Rd, Coral Springs, FL 33065-7421. This address change was put in by a retailer called Boscov. Rose spoke to an Experian agent, and they advised that someone put in for a Boscov credit card and made an address change. The Experian agent advised they would freeze all credit and stated they would institute a PIN in order for Rose to open up any other accounts. Rose called Trans-union, Boscov, Ulta, Kohls and Equifax in order to freeze her accounts. I advised that if Rose obtained other information to email or call the Maryland State Police Golden Ring Barrack. Rose was given all pertinent paperwork and the case number. On March 27th, I Trooper Lowery #7448, contacted Comenity Fraud in order to receive suspect information. I spoke with Comenity agent Jnae in regard to Roses incident involving identity theft and fraud. Jnae advised that Comenity did not have any suspect information. All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland. Due to the facts above, I request this case be suspended and be forwarded to CED / Cyber Crimes for further investigation.

On March 14th, 2023 at 1714 hours, I Trooper Lowery #7448, received an email from Rose to add additional information for an identity theft. Rose stated via email A FL phone number was discovered on one of my credit reports also. It is 786-297-4435. I may have missed this during initial reviews of them. This is most likely attached to the FL address that I gave you which was fraudulently put on my credit reports. Rose also advised Also, we discovered that FL address, 10786 W. Sample Road, Coral Springs, FL 33065-7421 is on my husband, Charles P. Rose, credit report also. We were able to determine that Boscovs sent that information to Experian when they sent it for my credit update. We have a joint account with Boscovs so they updated both accounts at the same time. We have a dispute in with Experian to remove them. All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.

On March 24th, 2023 Rose emailed me an update on the fraudulent charges on her credit and identity theft. Rose stated Another one of my credit card had fraudulent charges made to it which appeared on a statement. My Citi Custom Cash Mastercard (an additional card) had 3 fraudulent charges made on 3/5/23 for $50.00 each with the retailer Carnival Online HLSR AZ. I discovered this on 3/20/23 when I received the statement and called Citi and they opened a dispute for all 3 charges. Citi has credited me the full $150. All events occurred in Baltimore County, Maryland.
